column4: I'm getting a slight stuttering in my audio player when I have my cpu usage at 100%, is there a way to increase the priority of my audio player's process?
there's a command called "renice" for that on the cmd line
for ex, "renice 10 foo", changes priority of process number foo to 10
you can set smaller (higher) priorities, but only running as root
can you read minds?  I'm changing foobar2k's process priority!
hehe
smaller=faster
you can even set it down to negative numbers, if you are root
numbers are from -20 to 19
you can run the application with a given priority by using "nice" command too
renice changes it once it's already running
19 is the slowest possible nice level
if you want higher priority, you need a renice -10 or something in that line
ahk, heh
btw, your "foobar2k" claims "Media player with simple UI and low memory use"
in theory it should not need such renicing
it's windows
wine, in other words
why not run something like amarok =)
more than windows?
sounds like you didn't use it or read its code before doing such claims
